column4: what does this mean? gcc is unable to create an executable file.
If gcc is a cross-compiler, use the --cross-compile option.
Only do this if you know what cross compiling means.
bad things have happened to gcc
oh boy, any recommendations for fixing it?
did you install if from source?
no, it was a apt-get thingy
aptitude install build-essential says no packages will be installed, upgraded or removed
do a reinstall of it then
ok that I don't know how to do, link to a manual?
you can also purge it by 'sudo aptitude purge build-essential' and then reinstall it, which will get rid of its config files too
that only reinstalled the "build-essential" package and the error persists.
gcc is a c compiler, g++ is your cpp compiler`
